color_order.docs:
Should be one of `bgr` (default) or `rgb`.

*See also: [RPI_DPI_RGB Display Driver](https://esphome.io/components/display/rpi_dpi_rgb.html#configuration-variables)*

data_pins.docs:
A list of pins used for the databus. Specified in 3 groups:
  * **red** (**Required**, [Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)): Exactly 5 pin numbers for the red databits, listed from least to most significant bit.
  
  * **green** (**Required**, [Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)): Exactly 6 pin numbers for the green databits, listed from least to most significant bit.
  
  * **blue** (**Required**, [Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)): Exactly 5 pin numbers for the blue databits, listed from least to most significant bit.
  
  

*See also: [RPI_DPI_RGB Display Driver](https://esphome.io/components/display/rpi_dpi_rgb.html#configuration-variables)*

dimensions.docs:
Dimensions of the screen, specified either as *width* **x** *height* (e.g `320x240`) or with separate config keys.
  * **height** (**Required**, int): Specifies height of display in pixels.
  
  * **width** (**Required**, int): Specifies width of display.
  
  * **offset_width** (*Optional*, int): Specify an offset for the x-direction of the display, typically used when an LCD is smaller than the maximum supported by the driver chip. Default is 0
  
  * **offset_height** (*Optional*, int): Specify an offset for the y-direction of the display. Default is 0.
  
  

*See also: [RPI_DPI_RGB Display Driver](https://esphome.io/components/display/rpi_dpi_rgb.html#configuration-variables)*

With this boolean option you can invert the display colors. **Note** some of the displays have this option set automatically to true and can’t be changed.

*See also: [RPI_DPI_RGB Display Driver](https://esphome.io/components/display/rpi_dpi_rgb.html#configuration-variables)*
